page.title: 09ROBERT BURNS & KILMARNOCK(2)
page.content: THE FEDERATION OF BURNS CLUBS PROMOTES THE STUDY OF THE POETS WORKS IN SCHOOLS AND WERE SET UP IN 1885.IT HOPES TO PUBLISH A NEW COMPLETE EDITION IN 1986-200 YEARS AFTER THE FIRST (KILMARNOCK) EDITION. THERE IS A MONUMENT TO ROBERT BURNS IN THE KAY PARK, THE MONUMENT OCCUPIES A PROMINENT POSITION ON A HILLTOP AND AFFORDS AN EXCELLENT VIEW OF THE SURROUNDING COUNTRYSIDE. IT CONTAINS LETTERS AND POEMS WRITTEN IN BURNS' OWN HAND AND ALSO MANY INTERESTING BOOKS AND ARTICLES RELATING TO BURNS AND HIS WORK.
